metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5192 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When using the local_batch client from salt-api in SaltStack Salt before 2015.8.13, 2016.3.x before 2016.3.5, and 2016.11.x before 2016.11.2, external authentication is not respected, enabling all authentication to be bypassed. The LocalClient.cmd_batch() method client does not accept external_auth credentials and so access to it from salt-api has been removed for now. This vulnerability allows code execution for already-authenticated users and is only in effect when running salt-api as the root user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-cloud - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-common - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-master - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-minion - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-proxy - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-ssh - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-syndic - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: salt package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2017.7.4+dfsg1-1').
